summary_and_description:
Optimize startup performance through deferred toolbar loading

Proposed Solution:
Currently, the browser appears to fully render all toolbar elements (including processing bookmarks.htm) before displaying the main window. This likely introduces measurable delay during startup. 

Technical Observation:
- Toolbar button rendering may consume >100ms
- Bookmarks.htm processing (especially large files) compounds this delay

Suggested Improvement:
1. Display the main window immediately with empty toolbar containers
2. Load and render toolbar components asynchronously after UI paint

Rationale:
As demonstrated in other applications (like text editors), this creates perceived faster startup while maintaining functionality. The psychological impact of early window display outweighs minor subsequent loading delays.

Implementation Note:
This would require separating toolbar initialization into:
- Phase 1: Structural rendering (instant)
- Phase 2: Content population (async)

Developer Context:
(Original submitter confirms experience implementing similar optimizations in toolbar-heavy applications)
